title: AWS CloudFront and Amazon S3 for Single Page Application Hosting
description: This project shows how to host a Single-Page Application (SPA) using AWS CloudFront & S3. CloudFront serves the SPA content from an S3 bucket configured for static hosting.

introBox.headline: How it works
text: This pattern deploys the following resources:
- An AWS CloudFront distribution with the following configurations:
- Allows all HTTP methods for caching
- Sets custom error responses for 404 and 403 errors to serve `index.html`
- Uses an S3 bucket as the origin
- An S3 bucket to host the SPA content with the following configurations:
- Configured for static website hosting with `index.html` as the index document and `error.html` as the error document
- A bucket policy that allows CloudFront to access the bucket objects
The pattern ensures that the SPA content is served securely through CloudFront, while the S3 bucket hosting the content is private and accessible only through CloudFront.
